intro: Tetratheca pilosa var. calva, commonly known as the silky tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is a member of the family Theaceae and is known for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. The varietal name 'calva' refers to the smooth, hairless appearance of its stems.
